Job Description:
• Perform excellent customer service and demonstrate strong selling skills
• Take proactive steps to learn about our products
• Replenish products on shelf and participate in stock count
• Maintain good housekeeping conditions in the store
• Maintain well-presented visual merchandise and displays
• Assist in opening and closing of the store
• Assist in cashiering duties
• Assist and support in-store marketing events

Company Profile:
At DKSH, our purpose is to enrich people’s lives by providing access to goods, services and insights. United by our vision to be the trusted partner, we help companies grow in Asia and beyond across our Business Units Healthcare, Consumer Goods, Performance Materials and Technology.

Delivering life-saving drugs to hospitals, bringing high-quality products to remote villages, installing technology that raises living standards and providing new formulations for healthcare products that make life easier. These are just a few examples of how DKSH touches people’s lives around the clock. We do this while helping our clients and customers grow by providing services including sourcing, market insights, marketing and sales, eCommerce, distribution and logistics as well as after-sales services.

Listed on the SIX Swiss Exchange, DKSH operates in 36 markets with 32,450 specialists, generating net sales of CHF 10.7 billion in 2020. Founded by Swiss entrepreneurs in 1865, we have been deeply root
Contact Info: Contact Information Ms. Noev Sophea  087880661 jobs.kh@dksh.com No. 797, Corner Preah Monivong Boulevard and Street 484, Phnom Penh, Cambodia 087880661

Company Profile:
Cambodia Beverage Company Ltd (CBC) referred too locally as Coca-Cola Cambodia is a leading manufacturer & distributor of non-alcoholic ready to drink (NARTD) beverages throughout Cambodia. With our state-of-the-art bottling plant (commissioned in 2016) situated within PPSEZ, one of the leading Economic Zones in Phnom Penh.

The company produces 16 different beverages, under 8 brands, and within 5 different NARTD categories (Sparkling, Tea, Energy, Water, and Isotonic) which is supplied to our customers throughout the Kingdom.
CBC directly employs more than 850 staff while creating indirect employment opportunities for another 8,000+ staff across the Kingdom.

We are proud that >99.7% of our workforce are Cambodian nationals and that >31% of our staff are female, with women making up 37% of the senior management team. We are committed to increasing our female diversity and are targeting to have 50% female staff by 2030.
We are committed to integrating sustainability into everything we do.

By 2030 we aim to collect and recycle a bottle or can for each one we sell by 2030 and use at least 50% recycled material in our packaging.
We are committed to return to nature and communities 100%+ of the water we use in our drinks and their production. We are working to increase water security where we operate, source ingredients, and touch people's lives.
Contact Info: Contact Information TALENT ACQUISITION TEAM  010 325 777 / 096 48 99 677 / 096 355 6214 / 012 916 444 hrd@coca-cola.com.kh No.287, National Road 5, Mittapheap Village, Russey Keo District, Phnom Penh,  Kingdom of Cambodia. 010 325 777 / 096 48 99 677 / 096 355 6214 / 012 916 444

Job Description: •	Assist to establish, implement and maintain the Company’s compliance policies, procedures, programs, plans etc.;•	Prepare all applications for permits/licenses/approvals necessary for the operation of the Company with relevant authorities;•	Prepare draft legal advice and opinions to various business functions of the Company; •	Draft/review/translate letters/agreements/contracts with vendors and partners as assigned; •	Assist in reviewing insurance products and services for submission to the regulatory authority; •	Provide assistance in handling customer complaints and the investigation of complaints; •	Provide legal research in various laws/regulations relevant to the business; •	Assist all tasks as assigned to support the Company’s corporate secretariat function; •	Maintain proper docketing of company records including signed agreements, licenses, all approval letters and/or any other important documents etc.; and •	Perform other secretarial, legal, compliance, substantive and administrative duties and other tasks as assigned from time to time.
Job Requirement: - Law degree holder from reputable universities;- At least 3 years of relevant post qualifications working experience, preferably in legal firms or in house lawyers in insurance companies; - Good knowledge of legal requirements and procedures;- Good oral and written legal & compliance communication skills in Khmer and English; - Analytical with strong attention to detail; - Teamwork and fast learner; and - Independent, self-driven and resourceful.  - Experience in similar field is advantage;- Willing to learn about new industry; and - Understand complexity of in-house legal & compliance functions in insurance industry.
Company Profile:
Etiqa's history began in 2005 when Maybank Ageas (formerly known as Mayban Ageas), Maybank's insurance and takaful arm consisting of Mayban General Assurance, Mayban Life Assurance and Mayban Takaful merged with Malaysia National Insurance Berhad, Malaysia largest national insurer and its subsidiary, Takaful Nasional Sdn Bhd, Malaysia's premier Takaful provider. Two years following the merger, in 2007, the name Etiqa was born. In 2018, in support of Bank Negara Malaysia Financial Services Act 2013 Islamic Financial Services Act 2013, and to better serve our stakeholders, Etiqa has become four organizations:
Etiqa General Insurance Berhad (EGIB)
Etiqa Life Insurance Berhad (ELIB)
Etiqa General Takaful Berhad (EGTB)
Etiqa Family Takaful Berhad (EFTB)

job title: HR and Admin Officer (1 year experience) A1
position: HR and Admin Officer (1 year experience) A1
Job Description:
This position is responsible for supporting HR Manager in daily HR operations and administration, including talent acquisition, on-boarding, compensation and benefits, talent management, talent development and regional / global HR projects.

Talent Acquisition
•Post job vacancies in external job boards.
•Liaise with recruitment agencies in candidate sourcing.
•Shortlist candidate profiles and provide comments to hiring managers.
•Arrange and conduct job interviews.

On-Boarding
•Liaise with hiring managers and supporting functions (e.g. IT / Finance) in on-boarding arrangement.
•Prepare documents and resources needed for new hire employees.
•Conduct New Hire Orientation together with HR Manager.
•Answer enquiry from new hire employees.

Compensation & Benefits
•Prepare monthly payroll and reports.
•Administration of regulatory and company benefit programs.
•Conduct market benchmark salary and benefits study with HR Manager.

 Talent Management
•Act as business partner and provide HR advice to managers and employees.
•Coordinate employee engagement activities.
•Conduct regular meetings with managers on employees’ performance and people issues.
•Support HR Manager in annual performance management exercise.
Talent Development
•Support HR Manager in training needs analysis, training program design and post-training evaluation.
•Source external vendors for training programs.
•Coordinate with external vendors, internal trainers and employees in the delivery of training program.

Others
•Support HR Manager in the roll out of corporate and regional HR initiatives.
•Ensure all HR tasks are complied with internal policies and local regulations.
•Support HR Manager in HR reports, statistics and analysis.
•Maintain up-to-date employee records in P-file and HR systems.
•Support local office admin tasks.
•Ad hoc tasks assigned by HR Manager.
Job Requirement:
•At least 1 year’s solid experience as Human Resources Generalist in multi-national or global company is preferable, fresh graduates are also welcomed.
•Well versed in local labour ordinance and other HR related regulations (e.g. pension, retirement, occupational health and safety etc.).
•Strong interpersonal and communication skills.
•Strong analytic and execution skills with attention to details.
•Able to work independently after guidance.
•Strong operational excellence, innovation and continuous improvement mind-set.
•Proficiency in English and local language (written and spoken).
•Good PC skills (MS Office), experience in Tableau will be an advantage.

Job Description:
- Assist Finance Director prepare accounting system for the company.
- Manage cash flow and supervise financial transactions within the company to ensure there are no discrepancies in reports.
- Help accountants and manager to contact people within the company to update records for financial requests for purchase orders, making sure all documents are accurate.
- Maintain Fixed Assets Register to determine physical assets tagging
Bank Reconciliation Preparation.
- Advice on all financial issue to all subordinates and develop strategic plans and to brainstorm ways of reducing spending and increasing profits.

- Checking and verifying postings done by subordinators.
- Verifying payments vouchers before getting approval for payment.
- Review and audit financial statements and reports, ensure all calculations and data entries are correct.

- Knowledge of Cambodia accounting standards
- Knowledge of Cambodia tax laws
- At least 3 or 4years’ minimum experience of accounting and tax
- Good command of QuickBooks
- Good command of Microsoft word, excel, power point
- Good communication and leadership
- Fluent in English 
- Confident and highly motivated person

Company Profile: First Commercial Bank is the world’s top 200 Bank, with international credit rating A by the Standard and Poor's, and A1 by the Moody's. We have nearly 200 branches in Taiwan and 43 overseas branches/ sub-branches/ offices in 16 countries including USA, UK, Europe, Japan, Australia, Canada, Singapore, Great China, and ASEAN countries. The total employee numbers around the world are more than 8,000.First commercial Bank Phnom Penh Branch, established in 1998 in the city center, is one of the earliest foreign banks in Cambodia. In addition to the Phnom Penh Branch (Head Office), First Commercial Bank has 9 sub-branches, namely Chorm Chaov Sub-Branch, Olympic Sub-Branch, Chamkamorn Sub-Branch, Toul Kork Sub-Branch, Chraoy Chongvar sub-branch, Mean Chey sub-branch, Siem-Reap sub-branch, Phsar Derm Thkov sub-branch and Sen Sok sub-branch, which constitutes a solid operation network in Phnom Penh City.
